did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Vassar Club of Washington, D.C. Records

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Four volumes of minutes and financial accounting of the early incarnations of the Vassar Club of Washington, D.C., as well as photographs of a scholarship event in 2012.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Vassar Club of Washington, D.C. was founded in 1887 as the Association of Vassar Alumnae of Washington and the South. Four years later, in February 1891, a separate organization, the Washington Branch of the Vassar Students Aid Society was formed specifically to raise scholarship funds for Washington-area women to attend Vassar College. Another reason for the separate organization was to provide a group that could include women who had attended Vassar College but had not graduated. Later, when the main club decided to include non-graduates, the Students Aid Society disbanded and reformed as a club committee.
For further information about the club, see file 5.16 of the Vassar College Subject Files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Four volumes of minutes and financial accounting of the early incarnations of the Vassar Club of Washington, D.C., as well as photographs of a scholarship event in 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, May 2009. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, July 2024.

processinfo.p: Processed by Laura Streett, May 2009. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, July 2024.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Amy Walker (daughter-in-law of Katharine Walker, VC 1942), May 2009.
Transfer from the Office of Alumnae/i Engagement, July 2024. (A2024-029)
